title: How to Arrange Your House if Visitors Are Coming

steps.headline: Make sure that there is sufficient and necessary supplies for the visitors such as food, drinks etc.
steps.description:
If your visitors might consider using your bathroom or lavatory, some fresh towels and a plentiful supply of toilet tissue would be appreciated. steps.headline: Arrange the sofas, armchairs or chairs in comfy positions.
steps.description: A position where everyone will be facing each other and at the same time the TV, if any. Many people have visitors come into their home for a specific activity, such as a book meeting, a meal, to discuss family business, etc, if television is not part of the planned active of your visitors, don't make it the focal point if your entertaining space. If you have invited a lot of visitors, get more armchairs, sofas or chairs and arrange them properly so that you need not panic at the sight of too many visitors at the last moment.

steps.headline: Clean your house.
steps.description: Take your cleaning supplies, use them and clear out unwanted mess. Dust the furniture. Sweep all the corners, nooks and crannies of the house. Go a step further and use a vacuum cleaner if you have ones and flooring than be cleaned using one. Mop the floors of your house that can be mopped well and ensure you do so hours before the visitors arrive so that dirt does not accumulate before they arrived and it shall still look clean. Wash out carpets, curtains, mats, cushion covers, table clothes etc and dry them well. Be sure to leave enough time for carpets you was to dry. This can take several hours. Arrange all the books neatly in the bookshelf according to each category like fiction, non-fiction etc so that your visitors can have access to the books whenever they wish if reading is likely to happen. If your visitors have come round to discuss great Aunt Violet's funeral, there's not likely to be much reading going on.

steps.headline: Be prepared for weather changes.
steps.description:
There may be lot of changes in the plans of arrangement according to the weather If there's cold weather, get some fire logs and arrange the fireplace neatly. Get warm blankets and spread them on the sofas and armchairs(optional). If there is a heater in the room, switch it on half an hour before so that the cold visitors come to a warm and cozy home. You may like to put your central heating on throughout your home. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-5.jpg/v4-460px-Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-5.jpg/v4-760px-Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If its a hot weather, switch on the ACs and fans to keep the room cool. Remove any blankets or too warm cushions from the sofas. Just add one or too cushions for each sofa. Keep a bowl of mint chocolates for the visitors to suck on if they feel too hot, mint chocolates are considered to be extraordinarily cooling by some. Provide a bowl for your visitors to spot the mint chocolates out into when they're done sucking on them. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-4.jpg/v4-460px-Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-4.jpg/v4-760px-Arrange-Your-House-if-Visitors-Are-Coming-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}

steps.headline: Decorate your house lightly.
steps.description: Don't use heavy wall paper, dense fabric wall hangings and imposing pictures. Add a flower vase or two, keep your family photos on the shelves or on the tables neatly, change curtains(optional), drape the armchairs and sofas with a clean and attractively designed cloth so that if a child spills juice on the sofa mistakenly, the cloth will take the damage. (optional).

steps.headline: Know what you are going to prepare and how you are going to present it.
steps.description: Surf on the web and check different recipes that will please your visitors and satisfy them. Try them out and choose the recipe that you think is more appropriate. Serve snacks, a luncheon, an evening meal or a banquet, the choice is yours.

steps.headline: Get the required spices, vegetables, sauces and other ingredients ready.
steps.description: Go shopping in a local store and get the best quality ingredients you can. Go to the farmer's market if you want. Go to the supermarket if you like. Whether you purchase any food or drink you intend to serve has absolutely nothing to do with how you arrange your house if visitors are coming, obviously. If you are occupied with some other work, you can just order your supplies online and they will be at your doorstep in a matter of hours if such services are provided where you live.

steps.headline: Prepare your dishes two or three hours before the visitors arrive.
steps.description: Don't be in a hurry and mix up all the ingredients; go slowly and normally. Prepare mouth-watering dishes like Roast chicken, chicken jalfrezi, if the dinner is non-vegetarian, or vegetarian lasagne, vegetarian pizza. Serve halal food or kosher food if required. Make sure you know about any of your visitor's dietary requirements

steps.headline: Keep drinks ready.
steps.description: Arrange the drinks according to the weather. Try using hot cocoa and any other hot drink during winter and cold juice or fruit squash during summer. Some visitors enjoy tea and coffee. Wine is commonly served in some households.

steps.headline: Serve desserts after the meal; these can include chocolate brownies and ice cream.
steps.description: You may serve rhubarb and custard if you wish or simply serve coffee and cake.

steps.headline: To ensure that your visitors don't feel bored, have a conversation on any topic.
If there are any kids coming to visit too, arrange some toys or games or any thing that will prevent the child from feeling bored.
steps.description: Get games like Twister, specifically, it's an ideal game for when you are arranging tour house if visitors are coming, or must have something to had that keeps them busy and is fun.
